bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of ji 積 , accumulation, of phlegm-like saliva. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 72: 治積聚癥塊及涎積 等，續隨子丸方 , “To cure accumulation and collection, concretion-illness with lumps, as well as saliva accumulation , [use] the recipe for pills with xu sui zi ”. Xian jing 癇痙 , epilepsy and spasms [12]

Pathological Condition Combined Designation of xian bing 癇病 , epilepsy, and jing bing 痙病 , spasms disease. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Substance Entry shi dan 石膽：主明目、目痛，金瘡，諸癇痙 , “It controls clarification of the eyes, painful eyes, wounds inflicted by metal objects, and all types of epilepsy and spasms ”.
Xian re 癇熱 , epilepsy with heat [4]

Pathological Condition identical with re xian 熱癇 , heat epilepsy. Ming yi bie lu 名醫別錄 Substance Entry niu huang 牛黃： 療小兒百病，諸癇熱 , “It heals all types of children’s diseases, and all types of epilepsy with heat 』.
Xian ru 哯乳 , to regorge breast-milk [4]

Illness Sign of breast-fed children vomiting the breast-milk. Ben cao shi yi 本草拾遺 Substance Entry lu zhong chong 蘆中蟲：哯乳，乳飽後哯出者是 , “ To regorge breast-milk : This is when [a child] after having been breast-fed emits [the milk again]”.
Xian sou 涎嗽 , saliva cough [1]

Illness Sign of cough with an emittence of much phlegm and saliva. Pu ji fang 普濟方 64: 發聲散， 治語聲不出 , 胸滿短氣，涎嗽喘悶 , “The powder to [help a person to] emit sounds: It cures an inability to speak, a feeling of fullness in the chest, with shortness of qi, and saliva cough , panting and heart-pressure”.

Pathological Condition identical with yan hou 鹽齁 . Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry mu bie zi 木鱉子 quotes Zhai xuan fang 摘玄方 : 小兒咸 ：大木鱉子三四個，磨水飲，以雪糕壓下，即吐出痰 , “ Salt roaring in children: Grind three or four large pieces mu bie zi in water and prepare a [cold] drink [decoction]. This it to be forced down [into the body] with ice cream. This will immediately cause vomiting and eliminate the phlegm”.
Xian yong 涎壅 , saliva obstruction [1]

Illness Sign identical with xian chao 涎潮 , saliva upsurge. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 6: 治卒中風暗風， 旋暈，痰厥頭痛，胸膈涎壅，言語謇澀等疾，牛黃丸方 , “To cure ailments such as sudden wind stroke, dimness wind, and vertigo, phlegm recession with headache, saliva obstruction in the region of the chest and diaphragm, as well as impeded speech, [use] the recipe for pills with niu huang ”.
Xian zheng 險證 , perilous condition [2]

Pathological Condition identical with wei zheng 危證 , dangerous condition. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry ren shen 人參：痘疹險證：保元湯 , “For the perilous condition of smallpox papules: the ‘decoction that preserves the original [qi] ’”. Xiang ban chuang 香瓣瘡 , fragrant clove sores [3]

Pathological Condition of chronic chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions developing in the face to the side of the ears with gradual immersion by filthy liquid. Pu ji fang 普濟方 276: 其瘡多生於男子、 婦人面上，常言香瓣瘡 , “This type of sore frequently develops on the faces of men and women. It is commonly called ‘ fragrant clove sores ’”.

Xiang bo zhong feng 襁褓中風 , wind stroke [in the age] of swaddling clothes [1] Pathological Condition identical with qi feng 臍風 , navel wind. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry lu mao 驢毛 allegedly quoting Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 : 襁褓中風取驢背前交脊中毛一拇指大，入麝香豆許，以 乳汁和，銅器中慢炒為末。乳汁和，灌之 , “For wind stroke [in the age] of swaddling clothes take hair of an amount equalling the size of a thumb from the back of a donkey where in the front it intersects with the spine, add a little bean of she xiang , mix with breast milk, and gently roast in a copper vessel to eventually prepare a powder. This is again mixed with breast-milk to be instilled [into the child].
